poem:
Building Plans  

In the morning light, blueprints scatter,  
coffee brewing its usual dark schemes.  
The sound of hammers echoes  
where ideas clash with concrete,  
as councils and dreams negotiate  
over breakfast.  
Yet in this landscape of paper promises,  
the rooftops remain elusive,  
like sparrows resting on lines  
only the sky can read.
